title: Riattivare menu orizzontale per ordinare le e-mail
content:
Ciao a tutti, stavo provando a risolvere un problema relativo alla connessione, poiché a volte Thunderbird non completa l'invio o salvataggio di e-mail e, riavviando il programma con il tool per la risoluzione errori, sono state resettate alcune opzioni di base.

In particolare, non trovo più i pulsanti per ordinare le email in base ad un parametro (es. mittente, oggetto, allegati etc.), che prima erano sopra tutte le email e vicino a Filtro Veloce ed alla barra di ricerca.

è disponibile solo l'opzione del menù a tendina "Visualizza > Ordina per" ma da lì è scomodo! Io voglio il menù (con una riga simile ad una pagina Excel) sempre visibile!

Come lo riattivo? Grazie in anticipo.

PS: ma anche a voi capita che TB perda la connessione con il server e di non riuscire a sincronizzare bene i messaggi?

title: Hyperlinked text does not paste into Thunderbird email (Solved)
content:
I read through the previous discussion on this issue since I am suffering from the same issue of links not working as expected. I regularly need to forward messages which include links and none of the suggestions mentioned worked for me, and I do not recall this being a problem in the past.

I currently run Thunderbird 115.11.0 on Linux Mint 21.3 Cinnamon & have been using Thunderbird as my primary Email package for many years across multiple computers.

The work around is to to copy any email that is to be forwarded to the Drafts folder. Links are preserved and the message can then be edited as required and sent complete with the embedded links.

Hope this helps others who have the same problem.
creator: h.brissenden

title: Thunderbird stopped sending and receiving email suddenly.
content:
Yesterday, Thunderbird, version 115.11.1 (64-bit) suddenly stopped sending and receiving all emails. I received the following error messages: 1. Login to server pop.mail.yahoo.com with username ***@att.net failed. 2. Login to server smtp.att.yahoo.com with username ***@att.net failed.

I reset my password, but that did not help. I am continually prompted to reset the password. I verified that the ATT.net web account is working properly, where I can send and receive emails. I also verified that the server settings are all correct.

Incoming server setting: pop.mail.yahoo.com, Port 995, Connection Security: SSL/TLS, Authentication Method: Normal Password.

Outgoing server setting: smtp.att.yahoo.com, Port 465, Connection Security: SSL/TLS, Authentication Method: Normal Password.

Could you help me resolve this problem.

Thanks very much,

Norm Franke norm.franke@att.net

title: Logging in with second Gmail in TB
content:
When attempting to add a second email address to Thunderbird, I get the same error message every time. I have tried updating TB and restarting my computer, here are the steps I follow, please let me know if I should include any diagnostic logs/how to get them as well.

Please note that I already have an account set up that actively works, both sending and receiving gmail. Settings > Account Settings > Account Actions > Add Mail Account Enter my full name, and email address, but leave the password field blank according to other advice on this forum, although I have also tried with entering the address. Press Continue, receive the "Configuration found in Mozilla ISP database." message. Select IMAP > Done. See a google sign in page, with my email already filled in. Select Next. Then I get a Google 400 error page, reading: "400. That’s an error. The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That’s all we know." If I close that popup window, there is now a message in Thunderbird saying "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password."

Images with more details are attached below, note that this issue persists after both an update and a restart. Please ask any questions that can help you help me. Thanks in advance.
creator: augustreyniak

title: att.net email stopped working yesterday around 4:30 PM EDT

Error with account MyPrimaryBellsouthAccount Sending of password for user jarinker@bellsouth.net did not succeed. Mail server inbound.att.net responded: [SYS/TEMP] Server error - Please try again later.

I takes about 5 minutes to return this error on start up on when I use PF5 to manually check the mail.

My wife also has a bellsouth account she accesses via Thunderbird and it works fine on her laptop. So, I kind of think that rules out a home network issue.

I have some feeling that something somewhere has become corrupted in Thunderbird, but I am not sure what.

title: sent emails from 4 accounts just disappeared; 5th account still has them
content:
My sent emails from 4 of 5 accounts disappeared in Tbird but still on their servers.

Rackspace hosts 2, inmotion 1, and gmail, 2. One gmail account has the sent emails showing in Tbird. All are smtp accounts. The send file header shows the # of messages sent but there are no results showing. I have not changed any settings or new add ons for weeks so I did not do anything new. Maybe the app updated itself and there is a bug? I see in beta that compacting folders is a problem and wondering if this could be related?

Rackspace has the sent email on the servers. InMotion has sent emails Gmail has sent emails and one of the accounts still has sent email in a gmail account.

I'm repairing one of the accounts as I write but nothing showing up in sent file for that account. This is totally wacky. Thanks for any suggestions of why Tbird is wacky.

Cheers -- jim

Tbird and system specifics: System using Tbird version 115.11.1 (64-bit), STMP servers on all accounts Windows version: Edition Windows 11 Pro Version 23H2 Installed on ‎12/‎9/‎2022 OS build 22631.3737 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.22700.1009.0

title: No Oauth2 option found in setttings
content:
While using Thunderbird, it mysteriously stopped connecting to Yahoo Mail. This happens every few years and I think it's related to Oauth2 credentials.

I generated a new secure mail key and copied it into Thunderbird but that didn't work. So then I checked online, and one of the steps in the Thunderbird instructions is: "Select 'Server Settings' for mail account; Set incoming server 'Authentication Method' to 'Oauth2'; Click on 'OK' ". But Oauth2 isn't one of the options. The choices are normal password, encrypted password, Kerberos/GSSAPI, and NTLM.


I'm using POP. Tbird version 115.11.1.
